''Gevolon'' | location=[[East Beleriand]] | type=River | description=Mighty river | regions=[[Thargelion]], [[Ossiriand]] | towns=[[Sarn Athrad]] | inhabitants= | created= | destroyed= | events= }} '''Gelion''' was a river of [[Middle-earth]] in the [[First Age]], the principal river of [[East Beleriand]], being the border of [[Beleriand]] and [[Ossiriand]]. The vale of Gelion sloped steadily southward and thus had neither falls nor rapids, yet was ever swifter than the River [[Sirion]]. Although Gelion was twice the length of Sirion after its junction with [[Ascar]], it was less wide and full, for more rain fell in the west than in the east.{{S|Beleriand}} ==Course== Its two sources were at the hill of [[Himring]], via the [[Little Gelion]], and [[Mount Rerir]], via the [[Greater Gelion]] (which also had a tributary connected to [[Lake Helevorn]]). It then flowed south for forty leagues, dividing [[Estolad]] to the west from [[Thargelion]] to the east. Gelion met [[Sarn Athrad]] ("Ford of Stones") just above the inflow of the River Ascar. Gelion then became the western border of [[Ossiriand]], the Land of Seven Rivers, from which it was fed by the rivers: [[Ascar]], [[Thalos]], [[Legolin]], [[Brilthor]], [[Duilwen]], and [[Adurant]], all rising in the [[Ered Luin]]. South of the [[Falls of Gelion]], after Ascar met Gelion, that section of the river became swift and ever broader by the tributaries and thus was called '''Gabilān''' by the [[Dwarves of the Blue Mountains]] in [[Belegost]] and [[Nogrod]]. After its junction with Adurant, Gelion turned southwest, passing by [[Taur-im-Duinath]] (the Forest between the Rivers) before emptying its waters into the [[Belegaer|Great Sea]].{{S|Map}} There were at least 300 leagues of total length between Gelion's source and its outfall into Belegaer. ==History== The [[Green-elves]] who dwelt in Ossiriand lived under the protection of the river, for after Sirion, [[Ulmo]] loved Gelion above all other waters of the western world.{{LR|Quenta}}{{rp|§115}} Between the arms of Gelion lay the ward of [[Maglor]]. [[Caranthir]] made his abode at Lake Helevorn, and the land of Thargelion, which signified the Land beyond Gelion, was also called [[Dor Caranthir]], the Land of Caranthir. Due to the open nature of the land about the upper reaches of the River Gelion the region was subjected to many battles. [[Haldad]] of the [[Haladin]] built a stockade in the corner formed by the Gelion and the Ascar when an orc-raid fell upon his people in Thargelion.{{S|West}} During the [[Dagor Bragollach]] the dragon [[Glaurung]] came and destroyed all the land between the arms of Gelion.{{S|Fingolfin}} Eventually the lands between the rivers [[Aros]] and Gelion became so dangerous that [[Dwarves]] traveling to and from the Ered Luin and [[Menegroth]] stopped going in small parties but went in great companies well armed.{{S|Doriath}} ==Etymology== {{Pronounce|Gelion.mp3|Ardamir}} The name ''Gelion'' is [[Sindarin]], but it is never glossed. In the [[Noldorin]] phase of the language, it is related with the [[Ilkorin]] word ''gelion'' ("bright"). However, it is noticeable that the same name is glossed as "Merry Singer", but applied to [[Tinfang]].{{LR|Etymologies}}, entry "GYEL" ==Other names== In [[Khuzdul]], it was known as '''''Gabilān'''''. The Dwarves used the name only of the river south of the [[Falls of Gelion]] where the river became swift and ever broader.{{WJ|Maeglin}}, p. 336 The name contains the element ''[[gabil]]'' ("great"), that also appears in the Khuzdul name of [[Belegost]], ''[[Gabilgathol]]'' ("Great Fortress"). In a later text, [[Tolkien]] used the form '''''Gevolon''''', clearly a phonological development from the Dwarf-name ''Gabilān''.{{NM|P3ix}}, p. 311 == Other versions of the legendarium == In later writings, Tolkien decided that the Gelion and [[Celon]] "''river-names need revision to etymologizable words''". Tolkien proposed many names: '''Gelduin''', '''Gevilon''', '''Gevelon''', '''Duin Daer''', and '''Duin Dhaer'''.{{WJ|III}} The [[Ambarkanta maps|map V of ''Ambarkanta'']],{{SM|Ambar}} p.250-251 developed by Tolkien during the 1930s, shows the mouth of the Gelion in the ocean. The river seems to flow (if we do not take into account a pentimento in the sketch) into an unnamed bay comparable in size to the [[Bay of Balar]]. {{references}} {{ossiriandrivers}} [[Category:Noldorin locations]] [[Category:Pronounced articles]] [[Category:Rivers of Beleriand]] [[Category:Sindarin locations]] [[de:Gelion]] [[fi:Gelion]]
